definitions.definition: A conserved property of the light in an optical system which characterizes how "spread out" the light is in terms of angle and area : it is the product of its cross-sectional area ( normal to the direction of propagation ) and the solid angle it subtends .

main_definition: ( optics ) A conserved property of the light in an optical system which characterizes how "spread out" the light is in terms of angle and area : it is the product of its cross-sectional area ( normal to the direction of propagation ) and the solid angle it subtends .
